name: Wide-grip Pulldown
how_to_perform:
1. Sit at a pulldown machine and grasp the bar with a wide overhand grip, shoulder-width apart.
2. Keep your back straight and core engaged, focusing on maintaining a tight posture throughout the exercise.
3. Pull the bar down towards your chest by contracting your latissimus dorsi muscles, drawing your shoulder blades together as you pull.
4. Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together at the peak of the movement.
5. Avoid using momentum or jerky movements, instead focus on smoothly drawing the bar down and back up to the starting position.
6. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Wide-grip pulldowns are a back exercise that targets the latissimus dorsi muscles, focusing on proper posture and smooth movement throughout.
